span.span: Establishes a connection to a remote host.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果使用面向连接的协议 (例如 TCP), 则方法会在和指定的远程终结点之间同步建立网络连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol such as TCP, the method synchronously establishes a network connection between and the specified remote endpoint. 如果使用的是无连接协议, 则会建立默认远程主机。If you are using a connectionless protocol, establishes a default remote host. 调用后, 可通过方法将数据发送到远程设备, 或通过方法从远程设备接收数据。After you call , you can send data to the remote device with the method, or receive data from the remote device with the method. 如果使用的是无连接协议 (如 UDP), 则在发送和接收数据之前无需调用。If you are using a connectionless protocol such as UDP, you do not have to call before sending and receiving data. 您可以使用和来与远程主机同步通信。You can use and to synchronously communicate with a remote host. 如果调用了, 则从指定的默认值以外的地址到达的任何数据报都将被丢弃。If you do call , any datagrams that arrive from an address other than the specified default will be discarded. 如果要将默认远程主机设置为广播地址, 则必须先调用方法, 并将套接字选项设置为 , 否则将引发。If you want to set your default remote host to a broadcast address, you must first call the method and set the socket option to , or will throw a . 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. 方法将会阻止, 除非在调用之前专门将属性设置为`false`。 The method will block, unless you specifically set the property to `false` prior to calling . 如果使用面向连接的协议 (如 TCP), 并禁用阻止, 则会 引发, 因为它需要时间来建立连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol like TCP and you do disable blocking, will throw a because it needs time to make the connection. 无连接协议不会引发异常, 因为它们只是建立默认远程主机。Connectionless protocols will not throw an exception because they simply establish a default remote host. 您可以使用来获取特定的错误代码。You can use to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. 如果错误返回了 WSAEWOULDBLOCK, 则远程主机连接已由面向连接的连接, 但尚未成功完成。If the error returned WSAEWOULDBLOCK, the remote host connection has been initiated by a connection-oriented , but has not yet completed successfully. 使用方法可确定完成连接的时间。 Use the method to determine when the is finished connecting. > [!NOTE] > 如果使用面向连接的协议, 且在调用 之前未调用, 则基础服务提供程序将分配本地网络地址和端口号。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol and did not call before calling , the underlying service provider will assign the local network address and port number. 如果使用的是无连接协议, 则在完成发送或接收操作之前, 服务提供程序将不会分配本地网络地址和端口号。If you are using a connectionless protocol, the service provider will not assign a local network address and port number until you complete a send or receive operation. 如果要更改默认远程主机, 请再次调用所需的终结点。If you want to change the default remote host, call again with the desired endpoint. > [!NOTE] > 如果先前已断开套接字连接, 则不能使用此方法来还原连接。If the socket has been previously disconnected, then you cannot use this method to restore the connection. 使用异步方法之一重新连接。Use one of the asynchronous methods to reconnect. 这是底层提供程序的限制。This is a limitation of the underlying provider. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例连接到远程终结点, 并验证连接。The following code example connects to a remote endpoint and then verifies the connection. [!code-cpp[Classic Socket.Connect Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic Socket.Connect Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic Socket.Connect Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic Socket.Connect Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic Socket.Connect Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic Socket.Connect Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

则方法会在和指定的远程终结点之间同步建立网络连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol such as TCP, the method synchronously establishes a network connection between and the specified remote endpoint. 如果使用的是无连接协议, receive data from the remote device with the method. 如果使用的是无连接协议 (如 UDP), 则在发送和接收数据之前无需调用。If you are using a connectionless protocol such as UDP, you do not have to call before sending and receiving data. 您可以使用和来与远程主机同步通信。You can use and to synchronously communicate with a remote host. 如果确实要调用从指定的默认值以外的地址到达的任何数据报, 将放弃。If you do call any datagrams that arrive from an address other than the specified default will be discarded. 如果要将默认远程主机设置为广播地址, 则必须先调用方法, 并将套接字选项设置为 , 否则将引发。If you want to set your default remote host to a broadcast address, you must first call the method and set the socket option to , or will throw a . 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. 方法将会阻止, 除非在调用 之前专门将`false`属性设置为。 method will block, unless you specifically set the property to `false` prior to calling . 如果使用面向连接的协议 (如 TCP), 并禁用阻止, 则会 引发, 因为它需要时间来建立连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol like TCP and you do disable blocking, will throw a because it needs time to make the connection. 无连接协议不会引发异常, 因为它们只是建立默认远程主机。Connectionless protocols will not throw an exception because they simply establish a default remote host. 您可以使用来获取特定的错误代码。You can use to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. 如果错误返回了 WSAEWOULDBLOCK, 则远程主机连接已由面向连接的连接, 但尚未成功完成。If the error returned WSAEWOULDBLOCK, the remote host connection has been initiated by a connection-oriented , but has not yet completed successfully. 使用方法可确定完成连接的时间。 Use the method to determine when the is finished connecting. > [!NOTE] > 如果使用面向连接的协议, 且在调用 之前未调用, 则基础服务提供程序将分配本地网络地址和端口号。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol and did not call before calling , the underlying service provider will assign the local network address and port number. 如果使用的是无连接协议, 则在完成发送或接收操作之前, 服务提供程序将不会分配本地网络地址和端口号。If you are using a connectionless protocol, the service provider will not assign a local network address and port number until you complete a send or receive operation. 如果要更改默认远程主机, 请再次调用所需的终结点。If you want to change the default remote host, call again with the desired endpoint. > [!NOTE] > 如果先前已断开套接字连接, 则不能使用此方法来还原连接。If the socket has been previously disconnected, then you cannot use this method to restore the connection. 使用异步方法之一重新连接。Use one of the asynchronous methods to reconnect. 这是底层提供程序的限制。This is a limitation of the underlying provider. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例连接到远程终结点, 并验证连接。The following code example connects to a remote endpoint and then verifies the connection. between and the specified remote host. 如果使用的是无连接协议, 则会建立默认远程主机。If you are using a connectionless protocol, establishes a default remote host. 调用后, 可通过方法将数据发送到远程设备, 或通过方法从远程设备接收数据。After you call you can send data to the remote device with the method, or receive data from the remote device with the method. 如果使用的是无连接协议 (如 UDP), 则在发送和接收数据之前无需调用。If you are using a connectionless protocol such as UDP, you do not have to call before sending and receiving data. 您可以使用和来与远程主机同步通信。You can use and to synchronously communicate with a remote host. 如果确实要调用从指定的默认值以外的地址到达的任何数据报, 将放弃。If you do call any address, you must first call the method and set the socket option to , or will throw a . 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. 方法将会阻止, 除非在调用 之前专门将`false`属性设置为。 method will block, unless you specifically set the property to `false` prior to calling . 如果使用面向连接的协议 (如 TCP), 并禁用阻止, 则会 引发, 因为它需要时间来建立连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol like TCP and you do disable blocking, will throw a because it needs time to make the connection. 无连接协议不会引发异常, 因为它们只是建立默认远程主机。Connectionless protocols will not throw an exception because they simply establish a default remote host. 您可以使用来获取特定的错误代码。You can use to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. 如果错误返回了 WSAEWOULDBLOCK, 则远程主机连接已由面向连接的连接, 但尚未成功完成。If the error returned WSAEWOULDBLOCK, the remote host connection has been initiated by a connection-oriented , but has not yet completed successfully. 使用方法可确定完成连接的时间。 Use the method to determine when the is finished connecting. 如果启用了 IPv6, 并且调用了方法来连接到解析 IPv6 和 ipv4 地址的主机, 则在 IPv4 地址之前将首先尝试连接到 ipv6 地址。If IPv6 is enabled and the method is called to connect to a host that resolves to both IPv6 and IPv4 addresses, the connection to the IPv6 address will be attempted first before the IPv4 address. 如果主机未侦听 IPv6 地址, 则这可能会延迟建立连接的时间。This may have the effect of delaying the time to establish the connection if the host is not listening on the IPv6 address. > [!NOTE] > 如果使用面向连接的协议, 且在调用 之前未调用, 则基础服务提供程序将分配本地网络地址和端口号。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol and did not call before calling , the underlying service provider will assign the local network address and port number. 如果使用的是无连接协议, 则在完成发送或接收操作之前, 服务提供程序将不会分配本地网络地址和端口号。If you are using a connectionless protocol, the service provider will not assign a local network address and port number until you complete a send or receive operation. 如果要更改默认远程主机, 请再次调用所需的终结点。If you want to change the default remote host, call again with the desired endpoint. > [!NOTE] > 如果先前已断开套接字连接, 则不能使用此方法来还原连接。If the socket has been previously disconnected, then you cannot use this method to restore the connection. 使用异步方法之一重新连接。Use one of the asynchronous methods to reconnect. 这是底层提供程序的限制。This is a limitation of the underlying provider. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果使用面向连接的协议, 则该方法将启动与远程主机的连接的异步请求。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, the method starts an asynchronous request for a connection to the remote host. 如果使用的是无连接协议, 则会建立默认远程主机。If you are using a connectionless protocol, establishes a default remote host. 若要在完成时收到通知, 您必须创建一个实现 EventHandler\ 委托并将回调附加到事件的回调方法。To be notified of completion, you must create a callback method that implements the EventHandler\ delegate and attach the callback to the event. 调用方必须将属性设置为要连接到的远程主机的。The caller must set the property to the of the remote host to connect to. 调用方可以在 调用方法之前将属性设置为所需的任何用户状态对象, 以便可以在回调方法中检索信息。The caller may set the property to any user state object desired before calling the method, so that the information will be retrievable in the callback method. 如果回调需要比单个对象更多的信息, 则可以创建一个小类, 以将其他所需的状态信息保存为成员。If the callback needs more information than a single object, a small class can be created to hold the other required state information as members. 如果使用的是无连接协议 (如 UDP), 则在发送和接收数据之前无需调用。If you are using a connectionless protocol such as UDP, you do not have to call before sending and receiving data. 您可以使用和来与远程主机通信。You can use and to communicate with a remote host. 如果调用了, 则从指定的默认值以外的地址到达的任何数据报都将被丢弃。If you do call , any datagrams that arrive from an address other than the specified default will be discarded. 如果要更改默认远程主机, 请与所需的终结点再次调用方法。If you want to change the default remote host, call the method again with the desired endpoint. 如果要将默认远程主机设置为广播地址, 则必须先调用并将广播设置为。 `true`If you wish to set the default remote host to a broadcast address, you must first call and set Broadcast to `true`. 如果未执行此操作, 则该方法将引发。If this is not done, the method will throw a . 对象上的下列属性和事件是必需的:The following properties and events on the object are required: - - (可选) 可以在方法成功后, 提供可在套接字上自动发送的缓冲区。Optionally, a buffer may be provided which will atomically be sent on the socket after the method succeeds. 在这种情况下 , 需要将属性设置为包含要发送的数据的缓冲区 , 并且需要将属性设置为要从缓冲区发送的数据的字节数。In this case, the property needs to be set to the buffer containing the data to send and the property needs to be set to the number of bytes of data to send from the buffer. 建立连接后, 将发送此数据缓冲区。Once a connection is established, this buffer of data is sent. 如果使用面向连接的协议, 且在调用 之前未调用, 则基础服务提供程序将分配最适当的本地网络地址和端口号。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol and do not call before calling , the underlying service provider will assign the most appropriate local network address and port number. 如果使用的是无连接协议, 则在调用或方法之前, 服务提供程序将不会分配本地网络 IP 地址和端口号。If you are using a connectionless protocol, the service provider will not assign a local network IP address and port number until you call the or methods. 如果和的地址 系列不同,则方法将引发。The method throws if the address family of the and the are not the same address family. > [!NOTE] > 如果在调用此方法时接收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a when calling this method, use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性获取从最后一个 i/o 操作到的的连接状态。 `Connected`The `Connected` property gets the connection state of the as of the last I/O operation. 当它返回`false`时 , 要么从未连接, 要么不再处于连接状态。When it returns `false`, the was either never connected, or is no longer connected. 属性的值反映了从最近操作到的连接状态。The value of the property reflects the state of the connection as of the most recent operation. 如果需要确定连接的当前状态, 请发出非阻止的零字节发送调用。If you need to determine the current state of the connection, make a nonblocking, zero-byte Send call. 如果调用成功返回或引发 WAEWOULDBLOCK 错误代码 (10035), 则套接字仍处于连接状态;否则, 将不再连接套接字。If the call returns successfully or throws a WAEWOULDBLOCK error code (10035), then the socket is still connected; otherwise, the socket is no longer connected. 如果在用户数据报协议 (UDP) 套接字上调用 , 属性始终返回`true`; 但是, 此操作不会更改 UDP 的固有无连接性质。If you call on a User Datagram Protocol (UDP) socket, the property always returns `true`; however, this action does not change the inherent connectionless nature of UDP. ## Examples 下面的代码示例连接到远程终结点, 检查属性, 并检查连接的当前状态。The following code example connects to a remote endpoint, checks the property, and checks the current state of the connection. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果使用面向连接的协议, 则可以使用此方法关闭套接字。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you can use this method to close the socket. 此方法结束连接, 并将属性设置为。 `false`This method ends the connection and sets the property to `false`. 但是, 如果`reuseSocket`为`true`, 则可以重复使用套接字。However, if `reuseSocket` is `true`, you can reuse the socket. 若要确保在关闭套接字之前发送和接收所有数据, 应在 调用方法之前调用。To ensure that all data is sent and received before the socket is closed, you should call before calling the method. 如果需要在不第一次调用的情况下调用 , 可以将`false`选项设置为, 并指定非零超时间隔, 以确保发送排队等候传出传输的数据。If you need to call without first calling , you can set the option to `false` and specify a nonzero time-out interval to ensure that data queued for outgoing transmission is sent. 然后阻止到发送数据, 或直到指定的超时过期。 then blocks until the data is sent or until the specified time-out expires. 如果将设置为`false`并指定零超时间隔, 则会释放连接并自动丢弃传出的排队数据。If you set to `false` and specify a zero time-out interval, releases the connection and automatically discards outgoing queued data. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例为同步通信创建套接字, 并将一些数据发送到远程主机。The following code example creates a socket for synchronous communication and sends some data to a remote host. 然后, 它调用以停止发送和接收活动, 并调用以关闭套接字连接。It then calls , to stop the send and receive activity, and , to close the socket connection. summary.span: 释放 类的当前实例所使用的所有资源。

span.span: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在完成使用 `Dispose` 后，应调用 。Call `Dispose` when you are finished using the . `Dispose` 方法使 处于不可用状态。The `Dispose` method leaves the in an unusable state. 调用`Dispose`后, 必须释放对的所有引用, 以便垃圾回收器能够回收占用的内存。After calling `Dispose`, you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[清理非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)和[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). > [!NOTE] > 每次释放对 `Dispose` 的最后一个引用前，均应调用 。Always call `Dispose` before you release your last reference to the . 否则，在垃圾回收器调用 对象的 `Finalize` 方法之前，该对象正在使用的资源不会被释放。Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's `Finalize` method.

summary.span: 获取或设置 值，该值指定 是否允许将 Internet 协议 (IP) 数据报分段。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果数据报的大小超过传输介质的最大传输单位 (MTU), 则需要进行碎片整理。Datagrams require fragmentation when their size exceeds the Maximum Transfer Unit (MTU) of the transmission medium. 数据报可以通过发送主机 (所有 Internet 协议版本) 或中间路由器 (仅限 Internet 协议版本 4) 进行分段。Datagrams may be fragmented by the sending host (all Internet Protocol versions) or an intermediate router (Internet Protocol Version 4 only). 如果必须将数据报分段, 并设置了选项, 则会丢弃数据报, 并将 Internet 控制消息协议 (ICMP) 错误消息发回到数据报的发件人。If a datagram must be fragmented, and the option is set, the datagram is discarded, and an Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) error message is sent back to the sender of the datagram. 对传输控制协议 (TCP) 套接字设置此属性将不起任何作用。Setting this property on a Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) socket will have no effect. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示属性的用法。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. remarks.format: ## Remarks 目标进程应使用来创建重复的套接字实例。The target process should use to create the duplicate socket instance. 如果多次调用构造函数并将同一字节数组作为每次调用的参数, 则将创建具有相同基础套接字的多个托管实例。If you call the constructor multiple times with the same byte array as the argument for each call, you will create multiple managed instances with the same underlying socket. 强烈建议您不要这样做。This practice is strongly discouraged. 如果创建套接字的进程使用异步方法 (或), 则进程必须首先将属性设置为 true; 否则, 套接字将绑定到创建进程的完成端口, 这可能会导致要在目标进程上引发的。If the process creating the socket uses asynchronous methods ( or ), the process must first set the property to true; otherwise, the socket is bound to the completion port of the creating process, which may cause an to be thrown on the target process.

summary.span: 获取或设置一个 值，该值指定 是否可以发送或接收广播数据包。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the can send or receive broadcast packets.

value.span: 如果 允许广播数据包，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the allows broadcast packets; otherwise, .

value.span: 默认值为 。

span.span: The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 广播限制为特定的子网, 并且必须使用用户数据报协议 (UDP)。对于 Internet 协议版本 4, 可以通过将数据包发送到255.255.255.255 来广播到本地子网;或者, 你可以使用定向广播地址, 该地址是 Internet 协议 (IP) 地址的网络部分, 其中的所有位均设置为主机部分。Broadcasting is limited to a specific subnet, and must use User Datagram Protocol (UDP.) For Internet Protocol version 4, you can broadcast to your local subnet by sending a packet to 255.255.255.255; or you can use the directed broadcast address, which is the network portion of an Internet Protocol (IP) address with all bits set in the host portion. 例如, 如果 IP 地址为 192.168.1.40 (a 类 C 地址, 子网掩码为 255.255.255.0, 网络部分为前三个八位字节, 主机部分为最后一个八进制数), 则定向广播地址为192.168.1.255。For example, if your IP address is 192.168.1.40 (a Class C address, with a netmask of 255.255.255.0 -- the network portion is the first three octets, and the host portion is the last octet), your directed broadcast address is 192.168.1.255. 对传输控制协议 (TCP) 套接字设置此属性将不起任何作用。Setting this property on a Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) socket will have no effect. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示属性的用法。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. remarks.format: ## Remarks 完成对的调用。 completes a call to . 在调用之前, 需要创建由委托调用的回调方法。Before calling , you need to create a callback method that is invoked by the delegate. 此回调方法在单独的线程中执行, 并在该方法返回后由系统调用。This callback method executes in a separate thread, and is called by the system after the method returns. 在回调方法中, 调用 `asyncResult`参数的方法来获取正在进行连接尝试的。Within the callback method, call the method of the `asyncResult` parameter to obtain the on which the connection attempt is being made. 获取后, 可以调用方法以成功完成连接尝试。After obtaining the , you can call the method to successfully complete the connection attempt. 此`buffer`重载的参数包含在对的调用`bytesTransferred`中接收的数据, 参数包含在调用中传输的字节数。The `buffer` parameter of this overload contains the data that was received in the call to and the `bytesTransferred` parameter contains the number of bytes that were transferred in the call. 方法会一直阻止, 直到传入连接队列中有挂起的连接。The method blocks until a connection is pending in the incoming connection queue. 方法接受传入的连接, 并返回一个新的, 它可用于向远程主机发送数据和从远程主机接收数据。 The method accepts the incoming connection and returns a new that can be used to send data to and receive data from the remote host. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用创建并连接套接字, 并接受前10个字节的数据。The following code example uses to create and connect a socket and accept the initial 10 bytes of data. 回调委托调用以结束异步请求。The callback delegate calls to end the asynchronous request. 传输的字节数和数据在此方法的`buffer`和`bytesTransferred`参数中返回, 并显示在控制台上。The number of bytes transmitted and the data are returned in the `buffer` and `bytesTransferred` parameters of this method and are displayed on the console. Examples 下面的代码示例结束异步请求, 并创建新的以接受传入连接请求。The following code example ends an asynchronous request and creates a new to accept an incoming connection request. 有关演示与套接字的异步通信的完整示例, 请参阅[套接字代码示例](~/docs/framework/network-programming/socket-code-examples.md)。For a complete example that demonstrates asynchronous communications with sockets, see [Socket Code Examples](~/docs/framework/network-programming/socket-code-examples.md). remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一个阻止方法, 用于完成方法中启动的异步远程主机连接请求。 is a blocking method that completes the asynchronous remote host connection request started in the method. 在调用之前, 需要创建一个实现委托的回调方法。Before calling , you need to create a callback method that implements the delegate. 此回调方法在单独的线程中执行, 并在返回后由系统调用。This callback method executes in a separate thread and is called by the system after returns. 回调方法必须接受 方法返回的作为参数。The callback method must accept the returned by the method as a parameter. 在回调方法中, 调用 参数的方法来获取正在进行连接尝试的。Within the callback method, call the method of the parameter to obtain the on which the connection attempt is being made. 获取后, 可以调用方法以成功完成连接尝试。After obtaining the , you can call the method to successfully complete the connection attempt. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例结束了异步连接尝试。The following code example ends the asynchronous connection attempt. 有关演示与套接字的异步通信的完整示例, 请参阅[套接字代码示例](~/docs/framework/network-programming/socket-code-examples.md)。For a complete example that demonstrates asynchronous communications with sockets, see [Socket Code Examples](~/docs/framework/network-programming/socket-code-examples.md). remarks.format: ## Remarks 完成对的调用。 completes a call to . 直到断开连接完成后, 方法才会阻止。The method blocks until the disconnect completes. 有关异步操作的详细信息, 请参阅 MSDN library 中的异步编程概述主题。For information about asynchronous operations, see the Asynchronous Programming Overview topic in the MSDN library. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例为异步通信创建套接字, 并将一些数据发送到远程主机。The following code example creates a socket for asynchronous communication and sends some data to a remote host. 发送数据时, 将调用以停止发送和接收活动。When the data has been sent, is called to stop the send and receive activity. 然后调用以开始断开连接请求。Then is called to begin a disconnect request. 回调委托调用以结束异步请求。The callback delegate calls to end the asynchronous request. 请求完成后, 将查询属性以测试套接字是否已断开连接。When the request completes, the property is queried to test whether the socket is disconnected. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法完成方法中启动的异步读取操作。 The method completes the asynchronous read operation started in the method. 在调用之前, 需要创建一个实现委托的回调方法。Before calling , you need to create a callback method that implements the delegate. 此回调方法在单独的线程中执行, 并在返回后由系统调用。This callback method executes in a separate thread and is called by the system after returns. 回调方法必须接受 方法返回的作为参数。The callback method must accept the returned by the method as a parameter. 在回调方法中调用的方法, 以获取传递给方法的状态对象。Within the callback method, call the method of the to obtain the state object passed to the method. 从此状态对象提取接收。Extract the receiving from this state object. 获取后, 可以调用方法来成功完成读取操作并返回读取的字节数。After obtaining the , you can call the method to successfully complete the read operation and return the number of bytes read. 在数据可用之前, 将阻止该方法。The method will block until data is available. 如果使用的是无连接协议, 将读取传入网络缓冲区中的第一个排队数据报。If you are using a connectionless protocol, will read the first enqueued datagram available in the incoming network buffer. 如果使用面向连接的协议, 则该方法将读取尽可能多的数据, 最多可达在方法的`size`参数中指定的字节数。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, the method will read as much data as is available up to the number of bytes you specified in the `size` parameter of the method. 如果远程主机 使用方法关闭连接并且收到所有可用数据, 则该方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. 若要获取收到的数据, 请调用的方法, 并提取生成的状态对象中包含的缓冲区。To obtain the received data, call the method of the , and extract the buffer contained in the resulting state object. 若要取消挂起的, 请调用方法。To cancel a pending , call the method. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 给定线程启动的所有 i/o 都将在该线程退出时取消。All I/O initiated by a given thread is canceled when that thread exits. 如果线程在操作完成之前退出, 则挂起的异步操作可能会失败。A pending asynchronous operation can fail if the thread exits before the operation completes. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例结束挂起的异步读取。The following code example ends a pending asynchronous read. 有关演示与套接字的异步通信的完整示例, 请参阅[套接字代码示例](~/docs/framework/network-programming/socket-code-examples.md)。For a complete example that demonstrates asynchronous communications with sockets, see [Socket Code Examples](~/docs/framework/network-programming/socket-code-examples.md). remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法完成方法中启动的异步读取操作。 The method completes the asynchronous read operation started in the method. 在调用之前, 需要创建一个实现委托的回调方法。Before calling , you need to create a callback method that implements the delegate. 此回调方法在单独的线程中执行, 并在返回后由系统调用。This callback method executes in a separate thread and is called by the system after returns. 回调方法必须接受 方法返回的作为参数。The callback method must accept the returned by the method as a parameter. 在回调方法中调用的方法, 以获取传递给方法的状态对象。Within the callback method, call the method of the to obtain the state object passed to the method. 从此状态对象提取接收。Extract the receiving from this state object. 获取后, 可以调用方法来成功完成读取操作并返回读取的字节数。After obtaining the , you can call the method to successfully complete the read operation and return the number of bytes read. 在数据可用之前, 将阻止该方法。The method will block until data is available. 如果使用的是无连接协议, 将读取传入网络缓冲区中的第一个排队数据报。If you are using a connectionless protocol, will read the first enqueued datagram available in the incoming network buffer. 如果使用面向连接的协议, 则该方法将读取尽可能多的数据, 最多可达在方法的`size`参数中指定的字节数。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, the method will read as much data as is available up to the number of bytes you specified in the `size` parameter of the method. 如果远程主机 使用方法关闭连接并且收到所有可用数据, 则该方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. 若要获取收到的数据, 请调用的方法, 并提取生成的状态对象中包含的缓冲区。To obtain the received data, call the method of the , and extract the buffer contained in the resulting state object. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 给定线程启动的所有 i/o 都将在该线程退出时取消。All I/O initiated by a given thread is canceled when that thread exits. 如果线程在操作完成之前退出, 则挂起的异步操作可能会失败。A pending asynchronous operation can fail if the thread exits before the operation completes. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 完成在中启动的异步发送操作。 completes the asynchronous send operation started in . 在调用之前, 需要创建一个实现委托的回调方法。Before calling , you need to create a callback method that implements the delegate. 此回调方法在单独的线程中执行, 并在返回后由系统调用。This callback method executes in a separate thread and is called by the system after returns. 回调方法必须接受 方法返回的作为参数。The callback method must accept the returned by the method as a parameter. 在回调方法中, 调用 参数的方法以获取发送。Within the callback method, call the method of the parameter to obtain the sending . 获取后, 可以调用方法来成功完成发送操作, 并返回发送的字节数。After obtaining the , you can call the method to successfully complete the send operation and return the number of bytes sent. 如果使用的是无连接协议, 则在发送数据报之前将一直阻止。If you are using a connectionless protocol, will block until the datagram is sent. 如果使用面向连接的协议, 则会一直阻止, 直到发送了某些缓冲区。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, will block until some of the buffer was sent. 如果的返回值指示未完全发送缓冲区, 则再次调用该方法, 同时修改缓冲区以保存未发送的数据。If the return value from indicates that the buffer was not completely sent, call the method again, modifying the buffer to hold the unsent data. 不能保证发送的数据会立即显示在网络上。There is no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 为了提高网络效率, 基础系统可能会延迟传输, 直到收集大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 此方法成功完成意味着基础系统具有空间来缓冲用于网络发送的数据。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 给定线程启动的所有 i/o 都将在该线程退出时取消。All I/O initiated by a given thread is canceled when that thread exits. 如果线程在操作完成之前退出, 则挂起的异步操作可能会失败。A pending asynchronous operation can fail if the thread exits before the operation completes. > [!NOTE] > 成功完成发送并不表示数据已成功传递。The successful completion of a send does not indicate that the data was successfully delivered. 如果传输系统中没有可用于保存要传输的数据的缓冲区空间, 则发送将会阻止, 除非已将套接字置于非阻止模式。If no buffer space is available within the transport system to hold the data to be transmitted, send will block unless the socket has been placed in nonblocking mode. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例结束挂起的异步发送。The following code example ends a pending asynchronous send. [!code-cpp[Socket_Async_Send_Receive#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Async_Send_Receive/CPP/source.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[Socket_Async_Send_Receive#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Async_Send_Receive/CS/source.cs#6)] [!code-vb[Socket_Async_Send_Receive#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Socket_Async_Send_Receive/VB/source.vb#6)]

此方法成功完成意味着基础系统具有空间来缓冲用于网络发送的数据。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 给定线程启动的所有 i/o 都将在该线程退出时取消。All I/O initiated by a given thread is canceled when that thread exits. 如果线程在操作完成之前退出, 则挂起的异步操作可能会失败。A pending asynchronous operation can fail if the thread exits before the operation completes. > [!NOTE] > 成功完成发送并不表示数据已成功传递。The successful completion of a send does not indicate that the data was successfully delivered. 如果传输系统中没有可用于保存要传输的数据的缓冲区空间, 则发送将会阻止, 除非已将套接字置于非阻止模式。If no buffer space is available within the transport system to hold the data to be transmitted, send will block unless the socket has been placed in nonblocking mode. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 完成在中启动的异步发送操作。 completes the asynchronous send operation started in . 在调用之前, 必须创建实现委托的回调方法。Before calling , you must create a callback method that implements the delegate. 此回调方法在单独的线程中执行, 并在返回后由系统调用。This callback method executes in a separate thread and is called by the system after returns. 回调方法必须接受 由方法返回的对象作为参数。The callback method must accept the object returned by the method as a parameter. 在回调方法中, 调用 参数的方法以获取发送。Within the callback method, call the method of the parameter to obtain the sending . 获取后, 可以调用方法来成功完成发送操作。After obtaining the , you can call the method to successfully complete the send operation. 如果使用的是无连接协议, 则在发送数据报之前阻止。If you are using a connectionless protocol, blocks until the datagram is sent. 如果你使用的是面向连接的协议, 则会阻止, 直到发送整个文件。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, blocks until the entire file is sent. 不能保证发送的数据会立即显示在网络上。There is no guarantee that the data you send will appear on the network immediately. 为了提高网络效率, 基础系统可能会延迟传输, 直到收集大量传出数据。To increase network efficiency, the underlying system may delay transmission until a significant amount of outgoing data is collected. 此方法成功完成意味着基础系统具有空间来缓冲用于网络发送的数据。A successful completion of the method means that the underlying system has had room to buffer your data for a network send. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建并连接套接字用于异步通信, 并开始将文件 "test.txt" 异步发送到远程主机。The following code example creates and connects a socket for asynchronous communication and begins sending the file "text.txt" asynchronously to the remote host. 回调委托调用来完成传输。The callback delegate calls to complete the transmission. span.span: if the allows only one socket to bind to a specific port; otherwise, .

value.span: 对于 windows Server 2003 和 windows XP Service Pack 2 以及所有其他版本 , 默认值为。

span.span: The default is for Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP Service Pack 2, and for all other versions.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果为`false`,则多个套接字可以使用方法绑定到特定端口; 但只有一个套接字可对发送到端口的网络流量执行操作。If is `false`, multiple sockets can use the method to bind to a specific port; however only one of the sockets can perform operations on the network traffic sent to the port. 如果有多个套接字尝试使用方法绑定到特定端口, 则具有更具体的 IP 地址的套接字将处理发送到该端口的网络流量。If more than one socket attempts to use the method to bind to a particular port, then the one with the more specific IP address will handle the network traffic sent to that port. 如果 为`true`, 则在第一次使用方法时, 无论 Internet 协议 (IP) 地址如何, 都将尝试绑定到特定端口, 这会使方法的所有后续使用尝试绑定到该端口。在销毁原始绑定套接字之前, 将失败。If is `true`, the first use of the method to attempt to bind to a particular port, regardless of Internet Protocol (IP) address, will succeed; all subsequent uses of the method to attempt to bind to that port will fail until the original bound socket is destroyed. 在调用之前必须设置此属性; 否则将引发。This property must be set before is called; otherwise an will be thrown. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示属性的用法。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指定 在尝试发送所有挂起数据时是否延迟关闭套接字。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the will delay closing a socket in an attempt to send all pending data.

value.span: 一个 ，它指定关闭套接字时如何逗留。

span.span: A that specifies how to linger while closing a socket.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性更改方法的行为方式。 The property changes the way method behaves. 设置此属性时, 此属性修改 Winsock 可以重置连接时的条件。This property when set modifies the conditions under which the connection can be reset by Winsock. 仍然可以基于 IP 协议行为重置连接。Connection resets can still occur based on the IP protocol behavior. 此属性控制在调用数据时, 面向连接的连接保持打开状态的时间长度。This property controls the length of time that a connection-oriented connection will remain open after a call to when data remains to be sent. 调用方法将数据发送到对等节点时, 此数据将被置于传出网络缓冲区中。When you call methods to send data to a peer, this data is placed in the outgoing network buffer. 此属性可用于确保在该方法断开连接之前, 将此数据发送到远程主机。This property can be used to ensure that this data is sent to the remote host before the method drops the connection. 若要启用延迟, 请创建包含所需值的实例, 并将属性设置为此实例。To enable lingering, create a instance containing the desired values, and set the property to this instance. 下表描述了方法对于属性的可能值和存储在属性中的属性的行为。The following table describes the behavior of the method for the possible values of the property and the property stored in the property. |LingerState.EnabledLingerState.Enabled|LingerState.LingerTimeLingerState.LingerTime|行为Behavior| |-------------------------|----------------------------|--------------| |`false`(禁用), 默认值`false` (disabled), the default value|超时不适用, (默认值)。The time-out is not applicable, (default).|在默认 IP 协议超时过期之前, 尝试发送挂起的数据。Attempts to send pending data until the default IP protocol time-out expires.| |`true`能够`true` (enabled)|非零超时A nonzero time-out|尝试发送挂起的数据直到指定的超时过期, 如果尝试失败, Winsock 将重置连接。Attempts to send pending data until the specified time-out expires, and if the attempt fails, then Winsock resets the connection.| |`true`能够`true` (enabled)|零超时。A zero timeout.|丢弃所有挂起的数据。Discards any pending data. 对于面向连接的套接字 (例如 TCP), Winsock 重置连接。For connection-oriented socket (TCP, for example), Winsock resets the connection.| IP 堆栈根据连接的往返时间来计算要使用的默认 IP 协议超时期限。The IP stack computes the default IP protocol time-out period to use based on the round trip time of the connection. 在大多数情况下, 堆栈计算出的超时比应用程序定义的超时更密切。In most cases, the time-out computed by the stack is more relevant than one defined by an application. 当未设置属性时, 这是套接字的默认行为。This is the default behavior for a socket when the property is not set. 当 属性中存储的属性设置为大于默认 ip 协议超时值时, 默认的 ip 协议超时值仍将应用并将替代。When the property stored in the property is set greater than the default IP protocol time-out, the default IP protocol time-out will still apply and override. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示属性的用法。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. [!code-cpp[SocketPropertyTester#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SocketPropertyTester/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[SocketPropertyTester#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SocketPropertyTester/CS/class1.cs#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性获取一个 , 其中包含绑定到的本地 IP 地址和端口号。 The property gets an that contains the local IP address and port number to which your is bound. 在检索任何信息 之前, 必须将此转换为。You must cast this to an before retrieving any information. 然后, 可以调用方法来检索本地, 并调用方法来检索本地端口号。You can then call the method to retrieve the local , and the method to retrieve the local port number. 通常在调用方法后设置属性。The property is usually set after you make a call to the method. 如果允许系统分配套接字的本地 IP 地址和端口号, 则将在第一次 i/o 操作后设置属性。If you allow the system to assign your socket's local IP address and port number, the property will be set after the first I/O operation. 对于面向连接的协议, 第一个 i/o 操作将是对或方法的调用。For connection-oriented protocols, the first I/O operation would be a call to the or method. 对于无连接协议, 第一个 i/o 操作将是任何发送或接收调用。For connectionless protocols, the first I/O operation would be any of the send or receive calls. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例检索并显示本地和远程终结点。The following code example retrieves and displays the local and remote endpoints. remarks.format: ## Remarks 多播是 Internet 上多对多通信的可扩展方法。Multicast is a scalable method for many-to-many communication on the Internet. 进程订阅多路广播地址;然后, 由订阅的进程发送的任何数据包都由订阅了多播地址的每个其他进程接收。A process subscribes to a multicast address; then, any packets sent by a subscribed process are received by every other process subscribed to the multicast address. 对传输控制协议 (TCP) 套接字设置此属性将不起任何作用。Setting this property on a Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) socket will have no effect. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示属性的用法。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. remarks.format: ## Remarks Nagle 算法旨在通过使套接字缓冲小数据包, 然后在特定情况下将它们合并并发送到一个数据包, 从而减少网络流量。The Nagle algorithm is designed to reduce network traffic by causing the socket to buffer small packets and then combine and send them in one packet under certain circumstances. TCP 数据包包含40字节的标头以及要发送的数据。A TCP packet consists of 40 bytes of header plus the data being sent. 当使用 TCP 发送小型数据包时, TCP 标头产生的开销可能会成为网络流量的重要部分。When small packets of data are sent with TCP, the overhead resulting from the TCP header can become a significant part of the network traffic. 在负载较重的网络上, 由于这种开销导致的拥塞会导致丢失数据报和重新传输, 以及拥塞导致的传播时间过大。On heavily loaded networks, the congestion resulting from this overhead can result in lost datagrams and retransmissions, as well as excessive propagation time caused by congestion. 如果在连接上以前传输的数据保持未确认的情况, 则 Nagle 算法将禁止发送新的 TCP 段。The Nagle algorithm inhibits the sending of new TCP segments when new outgoing data arrives from the user if any previously transmitted data on the connection remains unacknowledged. 大多数网络应用程序都应使用 Nagle 算法。The majority of network applications should use the Nagle algorithm. 在用户数据报协议 (UDP) 套接字上设置此属性将不起作用。Setting this property on a User Datagram Protocol (UDP) socket will have no effect. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示属性的用法。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. [!code-cpp[SocketPropertyTester#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SocketPropertyTester/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[SocketPropertyTester#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SocketPropertyTester/CS/class1.cs#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将检查的状态。 The method will check the state of the . 为`selectMode` 参数指定以确定是否可读。Specify for the `selectMode` parameter to determine if the is readable. 指定以确定是否可写。Specify to determine if the is writable. 使用检测错误条件。Use to detect an error condition. 将阻止执行到指定的时间段 (以为`microseconds`单位)。 will block execution until the specified time period, measured in `microseconds`, elapses. 如果要无限期等待响应, 请将参数设置为负整数。`microSeconds`Set the `microSeconds` parameter to a negative integer if you would like to wait indefinitely for a response. 如果要检查多个套接字的状态, 可能更倾向于使用方法。If you want to check the status of multiple sockets, you might prefer to use the method. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 此方法无法检测某些类型的连接问题, 例如网络电缆损坏或远程主机已关闭意外。This method cannot detect certain kinds of connection problems, such as a broken network cable, or that the remote host was shut down ungracefully. 您必须尝试发送或接收数据, 以检测这些类型的错误。You must attempt to send or receive data to detect these kinds of errors. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建套接字, 连接到服务器, 并使用检查套接字的状态。The following code example creates a socket, connects to a server, and uses to check the status of the socket. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将数据读入 buffer 参数, 并返回成功读取的字节数。The method reads data into the buffer parameter and returns the number of bytes successfully read. 可从面向连接的套接字和无连接套接字调用。You can call from both connection-oriented and connectionless sockets. 此重载只要求你提供接收缓冲区。This overload only requires you to provide a receive buffer. 缓冲区偏移量默认为 0, 大小默认为 buffer 参数的长度, 值默认为。 The buffer offset defaults to 0, the size defaults to the length of the buffer parameter, and the value defaults to . 如果使用面向连接的协议, 则必须调用以建立远程主机连接, 或在调用之前接受传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either call to establish a remote host connection, or to accept an incoming connection prior to calling . 方法只读取从或方法中建立的远程主机到达的数据。 The method will only read data that arrives from the remote host established in the or method. 如果你使用的是无连接协议, 则还可以使用方法。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you can also use the method. 将允许接收来自任何主机的数据。 will allow you to receive data arriving from any host. 如果没有可供读取的数据, 则该方法将在数据可用之前被阻止, 除非使用设置超时值。If no data is available for reading, the method will block until data is available, unless a time-out value was set by using . 如果超过超时值, 则调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call will throw a . 如果处于非阻止模式, 并且在协议堆栈缓冲区中没有可用的数据, 则该方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 您可以使用属性来确定数据是否可用于读取。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 如果为非零, 则重试接收操作。When is non-zero, retry the receive operation. 如果使用面向连接的, 该方法将读取尽可能多的数据, 直到达到缓冲区的大小。If you are using a connection-oriented , the method will read as much data as is available, up to the size of the buffer. 如果远程主机 使用方法关闭连接并且收到所有可用数据, 则该方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. 如果你使用的是无连接 , 将从你在方法中指定的目标地址读取第一个排队的数据报。If you are using a connectionless , will read the first queued datagram from the destination address you specify in the method. 如果接收的数据报大于`buffer`参数的大小, `buffer`则将使用消息的第一部分进行填充, 超过的数据将会丢失, 并引发。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of the `buffer` parameter, `buffer` gets filled with the first part of the message, the excess data is lost and a is thrown. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例在连接的上接收数据。The following code example receives data on a connected . remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法将`buffers`数据读入参数, 并返回成功读取的字节数。This method reads data into the `buffers` parameter and returns the number of bytes successfully read. 可从面向连接的套接字和无连接套接字调用。You can call from both connection-oriented and connectionless sockets. 此重载要求提供一个或多个接收缓冲区。This overload requires you to provide one or more receive buffers. 值默认为。 The value defaults to . 如果使用面向连接的协议, 则必须调用以建立远程主机连接, 或在调用之前接受传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either call to establish a remote host connection, or to accept an incoming connection prior to calling . 方法只读取从或方法中建立的远程主机连接到达的数据。 The method will only read data that arrives from the remote host connection established in the or method. 如果你使用的是无连接协议, 则还可以使用方法。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you can also use the method. 将允许接收来自任何主机的数据。 will allow you to receive data arriving from any host. 如果没有可供读取的数据, 则该方法将在数据可用之前被阻止, 除非使用设置超时值。If no data is available for reading, the method will block until data is available, unless a time-out value was set by using . 如果超出了超时值, 则调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call throws a . 如果处于非阻止模式, 并且在协议堆栈缓冲区中没有可用的数据, 则该方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 您可以使用属性来确定数据是否可用于读取。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 如果为非零, 则重试接收操作。When is non-zero, retry the receive operation. 如果使用面向连接的, 该方法将读取尽可能多的数据, 直到达到缓冲区的大小。If you are using a connection-oriented , the method will read as much data as is available, up to the size of the buffer. 如果远程主机 使用方法关闭连接并且收到所有可用数据, 则该方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. 如果你使用的是无连接 , 将从你在方法中指定的目标地址读取第一个排队的数据报。If you are using a connectionless , will read the first enqueued datagram from the destination address you specify in the method. 如果接收的数据报大于`buffers`参数的大小, `buffers`则将使用消息的第一部分进行填充, 超过的数据将会丢失, 并引发。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of the `buffers` parameter, `buffers` gets filled with the first part of the message, the excess data is lost and a is thrown. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error of the message, the excess data is lost and a is thrown. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例指定了一个数据缓冲区、偏移量、大小和套接字标志, 然后在连接的上接收数据。The following code example specifies a data buffer, an offset, a size, and a socket flag before receiving data on a connected . remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将数据读入 buffer 参数, 并返回成功读取的字节数。The method reads data into the buffer parameter and returns the number of bytes successfully read. 可从面向连接的套接字和无连接套接字调用。You can call from both connection-oriented and connectionless sockets. 如果使用面向连接的协议, 则必须调用以建立远程主机连接, 或在调用之前接受传入连接。If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, you must either call to establish a remote host connection, or to accept an incoming connection prior to calling . 方法只读取从或方法中建立的远程主机到达的数据。 The method will only read data that arrives from the remote host established in the or method. 如果你使用的是无连接协议, 则还可以使用方法。If you are using a connectionless protocol, you can also use the method. 将允许接收来自任何主机的数据。 will allow you to receive data arriving from any host. 如果没有可供读取的数据, 则该方法将在数据可用之前被阻止, 除非使用设置超时值。If no data is available for reading, the method will block until data is available, unless a time-out value was set by using . 如果超过超时值, 则调用将引发。If the time-out value was exceeded, the call will throw a . 如果处于非阻止模式, 并且在协议堆栈缓冲区中没有可用的数据, 则该方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 尝试访问套接字时出错。An error occurred when attempting to access the socket. 请参阅下面的备注。See Remarks below. 您可以使用属性来确定数据是否可用于读取。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 如果为非零, 则重试接收操作。When is non-zero, retry the receive operation. 如果使用面向连接的, 该方法将读取尽可能多的数据, 最多可达 size 参数指定的字节数。If you are using a connection-oriented , the method will read as much data as is available, up to the number of bytes specified by the size parameter. 如果远程主机 使用方法关闭连接并且收到所有可用数据, 则该方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. 如果你使用的是无连接 , 将从你在方法中指定的目标地址读取第一个排队的数据报。If you are using a connectionless , will read the first queued datagram from the destination address you specify in the method. 如果接收的数据报大于`buffer`参数的大小, `buffer`则将使用消息的第一部分进行填充, 超过的数据将会丢失, 并引发。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of the `buffer` parameter, `buffer` gets filled with the first part of the message, the excess data is lost and a is thrown. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法用于连接的套接字或绑定的无连接套接字, 并用于读取传入的数据。The method is used on connected sockets or bound connectionless sockets and is used to read incoming data. 套接字的本地地址必须是已知的。The socket's local address must be known. 对于绑定的无连接套接字, 此函数限制接受接收的消息的地址。For bound connectionless sockets, this function restricts the addresses from which received messages are accepted. 函数只从连接中指定的远程地址返回消息。The function only returns messages from the remote address specified in the connection. 来自其他地址的消息将悄悄地丢弃。Messages from other addresses are silently discarded. 参数上的属性为窗口套接字服务提供程序提供有关读取请求的其他信息。 `e`The property on the `e` parameter provides the Window Sockets service provider with additional information about the read request. 有关如何使用此参数的详细信息, 请参阅。For more information about how to use this parameter, see . 若要成功调用此方法, 必须具有对象上的下列属性和事件:The following properties and events on the object are required to successfully call this method: - 或 or - 如果设置 if is set - 如果设置 if is set - 调用方可以在 调用方法之前将属性设置为所需的任何用户状态对象, 以便可以在回调方法中检索信息。The caller may set the property to any user state object desired before calling the method, so that the information will be retrievable in the callback method. 如果回调需要比单个对象更多的信息, 则可以创建一个小类, 以将其他所需的状态信息保存为成员。If the callback needs more information than a single object, a small class can be created to hold the other required state information as members. 对于字节流样式的套接字, 传入的数据将被放入缓冲区中, 直到缓冲区填充完毕、连接关闭或内部缓冲的数据被耗尽。For byte stream-style sockets, incoming data is placed into the buffer until the buffer is filled, the connection is closed, or the internally buffered data is exhausted. 对于面向消息的套接字, 传入消息会放入缓冲区中, 直到与`e`参数相关联的缓冲区的总大小。For message-oriented sockets, an incoming message is placed into the buffer up to the total size of the buffer associated with the `e` parameter. 如果消息大于缓冲区, 则缓冲区将用消息的第一部分进行填充。If the message is larger than the buffer, the buffer is filled with the first part of the message. 对于面向连接的套接字, 该方法可以通过两种方式中的一种来指示虚拟线路的正常终止方式, 这种方式取决于套接字是字节流还是面向消息。For connection-oriented sockets, the method can indicate the graceful termination of the virtual circuit in one of two ways that depend on whether the socket is byte stream or message oriented. 对于字节流, 已读取的零字节表示正常关闭, 不会再读取更多的字节。For byte streams, zero bytes having been read indicates graceful closure and that no more bytes will ever be read. 对于面向消息的套接字, 其中经常允许使用零字节消息, 并使用设置为本机 Winsock WSAEDISCON 错误代码 (10101) 的设置来指示正常关闭。For message-oriented sockets, where a zero byte message is often allowable, a with the set to the native Winsock WSAEDISCON error code (10101) is used to indicate graceful closure. 在任何情况下, 如果将设置为本机 Winsock WSAECONNRESET 错误代码 (10054), 则表示已发生异常关闭。In any case, a with the set to the native Winsock WSAECONNRESET error code (10054) indicates an abortive close has occurred.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 较大的缓冲区大小可能会减少空确认 (没有数据部分的 TCP 数据包) 的数目, 但也可能会延迟连接问题的识别。A larger buffer size potentially reduces the number of empty acknowledgements (TCP packets with no data portion), but might also delay the recognition of connection difficulties. 如果正在传输大文件, 或者使用的是高带宽、高延迟连接 (如卫星宽带提供程序), 请考虑增加缓冲区大小。Consider increasing the buffer size if you are transferring large files, or you are using a high bandwidth, high latency connection (such as a satellite broadband provider.) ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示属性的用法。The following code example demonstrates the use of the property. [!code-cpp[SocketPropertyTester#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SocketPropertyTester/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[SocketPropertyTester#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SocketPropertyTester/CS/class1.cs#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将数据`buffer`读入参数, 返回成功读取的字节数, 并捕获从中发送数据的远程主机终结点。The method reads data into the `buffer` parameter, returns the number of bytes successfully read, and captures the remote host endpoint from which the data was sent. 如果打算从未知主机或多台主机接收无连接的数据报, 此方法非常有用。This method is useful if you intend to receive connectionless datagrams from an unknown host or multiple hosts. 此重载仅要求你提供接收`buffer`, 以及表示远程主机的。This overload only requires you to provide a receive `buffer`, and an that represents the remote host. 缓冲区偏移量默认为0。The buffer offset defaults to 0. 大小默认为`buffer`参数的长度`socketFlags` , 值默认为。The size defaults to the length of the `buffer` parameter and the `socketFlags` value defaults to . > [!NOTE] > 在调用之前, 必须使用方法将显式绑定到本地终结点。Before calling , you must explicitly bind the to a local endpoint using the method. 否则, 将引发。If you do not, will throw a . 对于无连接协议 , 将读取接收到本地网络缓冲区中的第一个排队数据报。With connectionless protocols, will read the first enqueued datagram received into the local network buffer. 如果接收的`buffer`数据报大于大小, 则该方法将尽可能多地填充`buffer` 消息, 并引发。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of `buffer`, the method will fill `buffer` with as much of the message as is possible, and throw a . 如果使用的是不可靠的协议, 则过量的数据将丢失。If you are using an unreliable protocol, the excess data will be lost. 如果你使用的是可靠协议, 则该服务提供程序将保留多余的数据, 并且你可以通过使用足够大的缓冲区调用方法来检索这些数据。If you are using a reliable protocol, the excess data will be retained by the service provider and you can retrieve it by calling the method with a large enough buffer. 如果没有可供读取的数据, 则该方法将被阻止, 直到数据可用。If no data is available for reading, the method will block until data is available. 如果处于非阻止模式, 并且在协议堆栈缓冲区中没有可用的数据, 则该方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 您可以使用属性来确定数据是否可用于读取。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 如果为非零, 则重试接收操作。When is non-zero, retry the receive operation. 尽管适用于无连接协议, 但你也可以使用面向连接的协议。Although is intended for connectionless protocols, you can use a connection-oriented protocol as well. 如果选择这样做, 则必须先通过调用方法建立远程主机连接, 或通过调用方法接受传入的远程主机连接。If you choose to do so, you must first either establish a remote host connection by calling the method or accept an incoming remote host connection by calling the method. 如果在调用方法之前未建立或接受连接, 则将获得。If you do not establish or accept a connection before calling the method, you will get a . 还可以在调用方法之前, 为无连接协议建立默认远程主机。You can also establish a default remote host for a connectionless protocol prior to calling the method. 在这两种情况下, 方法将`remoteEP`忽略参数, 并仅从已连接或默认的远程主机接收数据。In either of these cases, the method will ignore the `remoteEP` parameter and only receive data from the connected or default remote host. 使用面向连接的套接字时, 将读取尽可能多的数据, 最大可达`buffer`大小。With connection-oriented sockets, will read as much data as is available up to the size of `buffer`. 如果远程主机 使用方法关闭连接并且收到所有可用数据, 则该方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 中使用的需要与中使用的匹配。 The of the used in needs to match the of the used in . > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例从远程主机接收无连接的数据报。The following code example receives a connectionless datagram from a remote host. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将数据`buffer`读入参数, 返回成功读取的字节数, 并捕获从中发送数据的远程主机终结点。The method reads data into the `buffer` parameter, returns the number of bytes successfully read, and captures the remote host endpoint from which the data was sent. 如果打算从未知主机或多台主机接收无连接的数据报, 此方法非常有用。This method is useful if you intend to receive connectionless datagrams from an unknown host or multiple hosts. 此重载只要求你提供接收缓冲区、必需的和表示远程主机的。This overload only requires you to provide a receive buffer, the necessary , and an that represents the remote host. 偏移量默认为 0, 大小默认为 buffer 参数的长度。The offset defaults to 0 and the size defaults to the length of the buffer parameter. > [!NOTE] > 在调用之前, 必须使用方法将显式绑定到本地终结点。Before calling , you must explicitly bind the to a local endpoint using the method. 否则, 将引发。If you do not, will throw a . 对于无连接协议 , 将读取接收到本地网络缓冲区中的第一个排队数据报。With connectionless protocols, will read the first enqueued datagram received into the local network buffer. 如果接收的`buffer`数据报大于大小, 则该方法将尽可能多地填充`buffer` 消息, 并引发。If the datagram you receive is larger than the size of `buffer`, the method will fill `buffer` with as much of the message as is possible, and throw a . 如果使用的是不可靠的协议, 则过量的数据将丢失。If you are using an unreliable protocol, the excess data will be lost. 如果你使用的是可靠协议, 则该服务提供程序将保留多余的数据, 并且你可以通过使用足够大的缓冲区调用方法来检索这些数据。If you are using a reliable protocol, the excess data will be retained by the service provider and you can retrieve it by calling the method with a large enough buffer. 如果没有可供读取的数据, 则该方法将被阻止, 直到数据可用。If no data is available for reading, the method will block until data is available. 如果处于非阻止模式, 并且在协议堆栈缓冲区中没有可用的数据, 则该方法将立即完成并引发。If you are in non-blocking mode, and there is no data available in the in the protocol stack buffer, the method will complete immediately and throw a . 您可以使用属性来确定数据是否可用于读取。You can use the property to determine if data is available for reading. 如果为非零, 则重试接收操作。When is non-zero, retry the receive operation. 尽管适用于无连接协议, 但你也可以使用面向连接的协议。Although is intended for connectionless protocols, you can use a connection-oriented protocol as well. 如果选择这样做, 则必须先通过调用方法建立远程主机连接, 或通过调用方法接受传入的远程主机连接。If you choose to do so, you must first either establish a remote host connection by calling the method or accept an incoming remote host connection by calling the method. 如果在调用方法之前未建立或接受连接, 则将获得。If you do not establish or accept a connection before calling the method, you will get a . 还可以在调用方法之前, 为无连接协议建立默认远程主机。You can also establish a default remote host for a connectionless protocol prior to calling the method. 在这两种情况下, 方法将`remoteEP`忽略参数, 并仅从已连接或默认的远程主机接收数据。In either of these cases, the method will ignore the `remoteEP` parameter and only receive data from the connected or default remote host. 使用面向连接的套接字时, 将读取尽可能多的数据, 最大可达`buffer`大小。With connection-oriented sockets, will read as much data as is available up to the size of `buffer`. 如果远程主机 使用方法关闭连接并且收到所有可用数据, 则该方法将立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection with the method, and all available data has been Received, the method will complete immediately and return zero bytes. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到, 请使用属性获取特定的错误代码。If you receive a , use the property to obtain the specific error code. 获取此代码后, 请参阅[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档, 以获取有关错误的详细说明。After you have obtained this code, refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. > [!NOTE] > 中使用的需要与中使用的匹配。 The of the used in needs to match the of the used in . > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例从远程主机接收无连接的数据报。The following code example receives a connectionless datagram from a remote host. 传递给方法。 are passed to the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法主要用于接收无连接套接字上的数据。The method is used primarily to receive data on a connectionless socket. 套接字的本地地址必须是已知的。The socket's local address must be known. 调用方必须将属性设置为从中接收数据的远程主机的。The caller must set the property to the of the remote host from which the data is to be received. 参数上的属性为窗口套接字服务提供程序提供有关读取请求的其他信息。 `e`The property on the `e` parameter provides the Window Sockets service provider with additional information about the read request. 有关如何使用此参数的详细信息, 请参阅。For more information about how to use this parameter, see . 若要成功调用此方法, 必须具有对象上的下列属性和事件:The following properties and events on the object are required to successfully call this method: - - - - - 调用方可以在 调用方法之前将属性设置为所需的任何用户状态对象, 以便可以在回调方法中检索信息。The caller may set the property to any user state object desired before calling the method, so that the information will be retrievable in the callback method. 如果回调需要比单个对象更多的信息, 则可以创建一个小类, 以将其他所需的状态信息保存为成员。If the callback needs more information than a single object, a small class can be created to hold the other required state information as members. 对于面向消息的套接字, 传入消息会放入缓冲区中, 直到缓冲区的总大小。For message-oriented sockets, an incoming message is placed into the buffer up to the total size of the buffer. 和属性确定数据放置在缓冲区中的位置以及数据量。The and properties determine where in the buffer the data is placed and the amount of data. 对于字节流样式的套接字, 传入的数据将被放入缓冲区中, 直到缓冲区填充完毕、连接关闭或内部缓冲的数据被耗尽。For byte stream-style sockets, incoming data is placed into the buffer until the buffer is filled, the connection is closed, or the internally buffered data is exhausted. 和属性确定数据放置在缓冲区中的位置以及数据量。The and properties determine where in the buffer the data is placed and the amount of data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将数据读取`buffer`到参数中, 返回成功读取的字节数, 并捕获从其发送数据的远程主机终结点以及有关已接收数据包的信息。The method reads data into the `buffer` parameter, returns the number of bytes successfully read, and captures the remote host endpoint from which the data was sent, as well as information about the received packet. 方法主要用于接收无连接套接字上的消息数据。The method is used primarily to receive message data on a connectionless socket. 套接字的本地地址必须是已知的。The socket's local address must be known. 此方法只能用于数据报和原始套接字。This method can only be used with datagram and raw sockets. 在调用此方法之前, 必须用设置为或的套接字类型初始化套接字。The socket must be initialized with the socket type set to or before calling this method. 当使用构造套接字时, 可以执行此操作。This can be done when the socket is constructed using . 对于面向消息的套接字, 会将传入消息放入`buffer`参数`size`中指定的总大小。For message-oriented sockets, an incoming message is placed into the `buffer` parameter up to the total size specified in the `size` parameter. 参数确定数据`buffer`中放置的位置。 `offset`The `offset` parameter determines where in the `buffer` the data is placed. 放置在中`buffer`的实际数据量由方法返回。The actual amount of data placed into the `buffer` is returned by the method. 方法自动方法将套接字选项设置为`true`第一次调用给定的。 The method automatically method sets the socket option to `true` the first time it is called for a given . 但是, 只有在设置了套接字选项后, 返回的对象才会对到达本地计算机的数据包有效。However, the returned object will only be valid for packets which arrive at the local computer after the socket option has been set. 如果套接字在绑定到本地终结点 (由方法显式或通过一个、、 或方法之一隐式的情况下) 和第一次调用方法时, 对方法的调用将为这些数据包返回无效对象。If a socket is sent packets between when it is bound to a local endpoint (explicitly by the method or implicitly by one of the , , , or methods) and its first call to the method, calls to method will return invalid objects for these packets. 若要确保所有对象均有效, 应用程序应在使用 方法将套`true`接字选项绑定到本地终结点之前将其设置为。To ensure that all objects are valid, an application should set the socket option to `true` before it is bound to a local endpoint using the method. 如果某个应用程序需要`ipPacketInformation`知道是否使用单播、多播或广播地址发送了数据报, 则该应用程序可以检查该参数。An application can examine the `ipPacketInformation` parameter if it needs to know if the datagram was sent using a unicast, multicast, or broadcast address. > [!NOTE] > 中使用的需要与中使用的匹配。 The of the used in needs to match the of the used in . > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法主要用于接收无连接套接字上的消息数据。The method is used primarily to receive message data on a connectionless socket. 套接字的本地地址必须是已知的。The socket's local address must be known. 此方法只能用于数据报和原始套接字。This method can only be used with datagram and raw sockets. 在调用此方法之前, 必须用设置为或的套接字类型初始化套接字。The socket must be initialized with the socket type set to or before calling this method. 当使用构造套接字时, 可以执行此操作。This can be done when the socket is constructed using . 调用方必须将属性设置为从中接收数据的远程主机的。The caller must set the property to the of the remote host from which the data is to be received. 若要成功调用此方法, 必须具有对象上的下列属性和事件:The following properties and events on the object are required to successfully call this method: - - - - - 调用方可以在 调用方法之前将属性设置为所需的任何用户状态对象, 以便可以在回调方法中检索信息。The caller may set the property to any user state object desired before calling the method, so that the information will be retrievable in the callback method. 如果回调需要比单个对象更多的信息, 则可以创建一个小类, 以将其他所需的状态信息保存为成员。If the callback needs more information than a single object, a small class can be created to hold the other required state information as members. 对于面向消息的套接字, 传入消息会放入缓冲区中, 直到缓冲区的总大小。For message-oriented sockets, an incoming message is placed into the buffer up to the total size of the buffer. 和属性确定数据放置在缓冲区中的位置以及数据量。The and properties determine where in the buffer the data is placed and the amount of data. 方法会在第一次为给定`true`指定时将套接字选项自动设置为。 The method automatically sets the socket option to `true` the first time it is called for a given . 但是, 在设置套接字选项后, 对象将仅对到达本地计算机的数据包有效。However, the object will only be valid for packets which arrive at the local computer after the socket option has been set. 如果套接字是在将套接字绑定到本地终结点 (由方法显式或隐式使用、 、 或方法之一) 和首次调用方法时, 对方法的调用将导致这些包的对象无效。If a socket is sent packets between when the socket is bound to a local endpoint (explicitly by the method or implicitly by one of the , , , or methods) and the first call to the method, calls to method will result in invalid objects for these packets. 若要确保所有对象均有效, 应用程序应在使用 方法将套`true`接字选项绑定到本地终结点之前将其设置为。To ensure that all objects are valid, an application should set the socket option to`true` before it is bound to a local endpoint using the method. 如果应用程序需要知道是否使用单播、多播或广播地址发送了数据报, 则该应用程序可以检查产生的对象。An application can examine the resulting objects if it needs to know if the datagram was sent using a unicast, multicast, or broadcast address.
